title: Hacker can request mediation for published reports

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi team, @jobert

**Summary:**
After creating the publish report, we do not have a field to send the requested meditation from HackerOne Support

**Description:**

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create publish report for any program
████████

2. Use query
`https://hackerone.com/reports/`***number_publish_report***`/hacker_help`

My
`https://hackerone.com/reports/███/hacker_help`
POST:
`message=123&mediation_type=unresponsive`


3. Next check report

███


I understand the degree of low, but this is a disagreement between the web and the end point.

Sorry i bad speak english
I hope you understand me
Thank you,haxta4ok00

## Impact

Creating a query `requested meditation from HackerOne Support`  without being able to do so
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi team, @jobert

Summary:
After creating the publish report, we do not have a field to send the requested meditation from HackerOne Support

Description:

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Create publish report for any program
    ████████

  2. Use query
    https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/hacker_help

My
https://hackerone.com/reports/███/hacker_help
POST:
message=123&mediation_type=unresponsive

  1. Next check report

███

I understand the degree of low, but this is a disagreement between the web and the end point.

Sorry i bad speak english
I hope you understand me
Thank you,haxta4ok00

Impact

Creating a query requested meditation from HackerOne Support without being able to do so

additional_data.old_title: Ability to send requested meditation from HackerOne Support without being able to in a public report
additional_data.new_title: Hacker can request mediation for published reports

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your report! Was there any sensitive information that you could extract with this issue? It seems that this triggers unwanted notifications for the program members (if any), which we should address. I'm not sure if this is an actual risk for HackerOne, but I'm happy to consider it as such for the time being. We will look into this and see what the side effects of this are. We will keep you posted throughout the process. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - thanks for your report! Was there any sensitive information that you could extract with this issue? It seems that this triggers unwanted notifications for the program members (if any), which we should address. I'm not sure if this is an actual risk for HackerOne, but I'm happy to consider it as such for the time being. We will look into this and see what the side effects of this are. We will keep you posted throughout the process. Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert - Glad to see you and report status.
Right now, there's no confidential information yet. But I'm looking for a study on the problem. If I find anything, I'll let you know.Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert - Glad to see you and report status.
Right now, there's no confidential information yet. But I'm looking for a study on the problem. If I find anything, I'll let you know.Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert

1) I want to apologize that create a lot of extra messages.
2) But after all the tests I did. I didn't pay attention to one of my answers in another report that just fits here.
3) 
>Was there any sensitive information that you could extract with this issue?

Due to the fact that we can request a request from these reports, this point therefore works. This point reveals to us the average value of averageResolutionTime, if it is included in the program.

██████ -- Original message

Part message :

████ (GET)

Answer:
`{"bountyDisagreement":false,"resolutionDisagreement":false,"unresponsiveTeam":true,"other":false,
"report":{"age":"about 19 hours"},"team":{"name":"██████████","withinAverageResolutionTime":true,"averageResolutionTime":"7 months"}}`

I hope you understand me. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert

1) I want to apologize that create a lot of extra messages.
2) But after all the tests I did. I didn't pay attention to one of my answers in another report that just fits here.
3)

Was there any sensitive information that you could extract with this issue?

Due to the fact that we can request a request from these reports, this point therefore works. This point reveals to us the average value of averageResolutionTime, if it is included in the program.

██████ -- Original message

Part message :

████ (GET)

Answer:
{"bountyDisagreement":false,"resolutionDisagreement":false,"unresponsiveTeam":true,"other":false,
"report":{"age":"about 19 hours"},"team":{"name":"██████████","withinAverageResolutionTime":true,"averageResolutionTime":"7 months"}}

I hope you understand me. Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert , @bencode , today after my testing i can't using this case - https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/hacker_help , this is fixed?

But case https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/mediation_requests/unresponsive work
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert , @bencode , today after my testing i can't using this case - https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/hacker_help , this is fixed?

But case https://hackerone.com/reports/number_publish_report/mediation_requests/unresponsive work

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - apologies for the delay in getting back to you. This vulnerability was fixed on October 25th and we missed closing it. You're right that the mediation requests endpoint can still be viewed. Now that a user won't be able to request mediation anymore for published reports, we're OK with that. We may fix that at some point. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention. Good luck and happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - apologies for the delay in getting back to you. This vulnerability was fixed on October 25th and we missed closing it. You're right that the mediation requests endpoint can still be viewed. Now that a user won't be able to request mediation anymore for published reports, we're OK with that. We may fix that at some point. Thanks again for bringing this to our attention. Good luck and happy hacking!
